summary: The Stop Musk Act, introduced in the House of Representatives, aims to protect federal employees from retaliation for actions taken to prevent Elon Musk, or those under his oversight, from engaging in unlawful or unconstitutional actions related to federal agencies. The bill explicitly references Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, placing the document in the public domain.  The bill's purpose is to shield employees who resist Musk's activities which violate law or the Constitution.
